Dear Mr. Zolman:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
9/29/25. Due to the violation of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan
is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
CPA Rule 400.12303 Financial Stability
(1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient financing,
on an ongoing basis, to ensure the agency is carrying
out its programs and meeting the requirements for
licensing. A plan of financing must include all the
following:
(e) An audit of all financial accounts conducted
annually by an independent certified public
accountant not administratively related to the agency.
A copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
The agency did not have an independent financial audit completed for 2024.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/1/24 Interim, CAP approved 11/6/24
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Financial Audit: The agency made a good faith effort to complete an audit as
required, but there was a misunderstanding with the certified public
accountant of what was required. The agency had a Compilation Report
completed by their certified public accountant for 2023 and 2024. The agency
reported they were advised by their accountant that this Compilation report
would meet the audit requirement. However, upon review of the report, it
specifically stated that an “audit” was not completed. The agency was advised

that an audit was required and should include statement of financial position,
activities, functional expenses, and cash flow.
• Adoption Applications: The agency was reminded to ensure that applicants
sign and date their Orientation and Application with the correct dates.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
10/1/24 Interim, CAP approved 11/6/24: The agency was cited regarding Rule
203, as an annual financial audit had not been completed. The agency indicated
they successfully implemented their CAP as they submitted a document from their
accountant for 2023 and 2024. However, the document was reviewed and found
to be a Compilation Report, not an audit. Therefore, a repeat violation was found
and the agency is required to submit a CAP. The agency is now aware of what is
required for a financial audit to meet the rule requirement.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment dated 9/29/25 was reviewed and discussed.
The agency did not identify any needs or systemic issues. There was one
disrupted placement during this review period, for a child that was placed in a pre-
adoptive home for six months. The adoptive parents chose not to finalize the
adoption, without explanation.
Financial Overview
The agency provided their 2025 budget, as well as a Compilation Report from their
accountant for 2023 and 2024. No concerns were noted. However, the agency did
not submit an annual audit completed by their accountant, as required by the rules
and reflected in the citation of rule 400.12303 (1)(e).
Staff Interviews
Two adoption staff were interviewed. Both had been with the agency for over one
year. Staff reported they enjoyed their positions and working with families and
children. Staff stated their caseloads are manageable, Administration is easy to
communicate with and open to feedback, and flexibility in their schedule is

something they really appreciate. Staff did not report any concerns regarding the
agency or their supervisor.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same building as previous years. The
building has sufficient space for staff to work and meet with clients. Files and
confidential information are kept in locked storage cabinets. Closed adoption files
are kept in a separate locked cabinet in the basement of the building.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services, therefore this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. A corrective action plan is required.
